body:
I looked around and didn't found any go-wraper tests in the gccgo testsuite. The go-wrapper is built and tested in google's go, so there is no a sane way to test the gccgo interaction anyway. 

As far as I am concerned, you can close the bug. The tests passed with a gccgo (the same environment/configuration) from current gcc tip:
```
gccgo -v
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=gccgo
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/opt/gccgo/libexec/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/6.0.0/lto-wrapper
Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Configured with: /repo/go/gccgo-git/configure --disable-multilib --enable-languages=go --prefix=/opt/gccgo --with-ld=/usr/bin/ld.gold --disable-nls --disable-bootstrap
Thread model: posix
gcc version 6.0.0 20150810 (experimental) (GCC) 
```
